content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is the function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    lines = split(replace(md, "\n", ""), '\n')
    lines_without_headers = filter(!startswith, lines)
    code_blocks = findall(r"^```.*?```", lines_without_headers)
    if length(code_blocks) == 0
        return ""
    end
    code_block_indices = [parse(Int, m) for m in code_blocks]
    sort!(code_block_indices)
    start_index = code_block_indices[1]
    end_index = code_block_indices[end]
    return join(lines_without_headers[start_index:end_index], "\n")
end
```

The function `extract_julia_code` takes a markdown document as an input and returns a string with all the Julia code blocks extracted, joined together with newline characters. If there are no code blocks in the given document, it will return an empty string.
